channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [FLINK-35154] Javadoc aggregate fails
item.description:
Javadoc plugin fails with error. Using

javadoc:aggregate

ERROR:

[WARNING] The requested profile "include-hadoop" could not be activated because it does not exist.
[WARNING] The requested profile "arm" could not be activated because it does not exist.
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-javadoc-plugin:2.9.1:aggregate (default-cli) on project flink-parent: An error has occurred in JavaDocs report generation: 
[ERROR] Exit code: 1 - /{flinkProjectDir}/flink-end-to-end-tests/flink-confluent-schema-registry/target/generated-sources/example/avro/EventType.java:8: error: type GenericEnumSymbol does not take parameters
[ERROR] public enum EventType implements org.apache.avro.generic.GenericEnumSymbol<EventType> {
[ERROR]    

 

For our flink 1.17 ERROR

[ERROR] /{flinkProjectDir}/flink-connectors/flink-sql-connector-hive-3.1.3/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/metastore/HiveMetaStoreClient.java:21: error: cannot find symbol
[ERROR] import static org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.Warehouse.DEFAULT_DATABASE_NAME;
[ERROR] ^
[ERROR]   symbol:   static DEFAULT_DATABASE_NAME
[ERROR]   location: class

 

Need to increase version of javadoc plugin from 2.9.1 to 2.10.4 (In current version exists bug same with this)

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment:
MartijnVisser trohrmann 

Hi,

Please, assign me to this task
Is this issue the reason why https://nightlies.apache.org/flink/flink-docs-release-1.16/api/java/ works, but https://nightlies.apache.org/flink/flink-docs-release-1.19/api/java/ doesn't work?

It seems that this file controls the docs build: https://github.com/apache/flink/blob/3d79387604818a3f6dbf05c09642d651f8feabda/.github/workflows/docs.yml
But recent builds don't have a failure: https://github.com/apache/flink/actions/runs/9848601763/job/27190828070

[ERROR] /Users/samrat/Code/oss/flink/flink-core/src/main/java/org/apache/flink/api/connector/sink2/Sink.java:116: warning - Tag @link: reference not found: SerializationSchema.InitializationContext
[ERROR] javadoc: error - com.sun.tools.javadoc.ClassDocImpl cannot be cast to com.sun.javadoc.AnnotationTypeDoc
[ERROR] 
[ERROR] Command line was: /Users/samrat/.sdkman/candidates/java/8.0.412.fx-zulu/bin/javadoc -Xdoclint:none @options @packages @argfile
[ERROR] 
[ERROR] Refer to the generated Javadoc files in '/Users/samrat/Code/oss/flink/target/site/apidocs' dir.
[ERROR] 

Upgrade to https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.maven.plugins/maven-javadoc-plugin/3.7.0 will close the issue

samrat007 based on the PR attached to this Jira ticket, Flink is currently using the javadoc plugin v2.9.1.
The PR suggests to go to 2.10.4, you are suggesting to go to 3.7.0.
I would like to understand
(a) what is the difference in javadoc 2.x vs 3.x. I'm afraid such a major version bump might cause other issues.
(b) Why is our javadocs page broken, while the GitHub Actions CI run I've posted above is running successfully: https://github.com/apache/flink/actions/runs/9848601763/job/27190828070. I would like to first understand the issue, before bumping the version. Maybe the issue with the Flink docs not being shown has nothing to do with the javadoc version or the build failure you are seeing locally.

a)

Based on the release notes of the Javadoc Plugin, upgrading from v2.9.1 to 3.x offers numerous benefits, including improved compatibility, enhanced features, and better performance. Here are the key improvements:

  • 2.x: Primarily supports older Java versions.
  • 3.x: Fully supports newer Java versions, including Java 11 and beyond, aligning with Flink's support for newer Java versions.
  • 2.x: Limited configuration options with basic Javadoc generation capabilities.
  • 3.x: Enhanced configuration options, improved handling of module systems, and support for new Javadoc features and tags introduced in recent Java versions.
  • Bug fixes and performance improvements in 3.x

 

I am  suggesting to go to 3.7.0 for following reasons :

  1. Flink supports newer Java versions, and upgrading to Javadoc Plugin 3.x ensures compatibility and leverages new Java features.
  2. The Javadoc Plugin is used solely for generating Java API documentation and is not a runtime requirement for Flink applications. Any issue due to major version bump will be caught before release of 1.20 during api doc generation.
  3. If any issues arise during the Javadoc generation process after upgrading to 3.x, we can easily revert to the previous version (2.10.x) without affecting the overall build process. 

 

 

b) from the logs of Github Actions: 
 

 1 error    38333100 warnings    38334Error:  Error while creating javadoc report:    38335Exit code: 1 - /root/flink/flink-end-to-end-tests/flink-confluent-schema-registry/target/generated-sources/example/avro/EventType.java:8: error: type GenericEnumSymbol does not take parameters    38336public enum EventType implements org.apache.avro.generic.GenericEnumSymbol<EventType> {    38337 ^    38338/root/flink/flink-annotations/src/main/java/org/apache/flink/annotation/docs/ConfigGroup.java:33: warning - Tag @link: reference not found: ConfigOptionsDocGenerator    38339/root/flink/flink-test-utils-parent/flink-test-utils-junit/src/main/java/org/apache/flink/testutils/junit/extensions/parameterized/Parameter.java:34: warning - Tag @link: reference not found: Parameterized.Parameter    38340/root/flink/flink-test-utils-parent/flink-test-utils-junit/src/main/java/org/apache/flink/core/testutils/CustomExtension.java:46: warning - Missing closing '}' character for inline tag: "{@code    38341 public class Test{    38342 CustomExtension eachCustom = new CustomExtensionImpl1();    38343 CustomExtension allCustom = new CustomExtensionImpl2();"    38344/root/flink/flink-test-utils-parent/flink-test-utils-junit/src/main/java/org/apache/flink/core/testutils/CustomExtension.java:46: warning - @RegisterExtension is an unknown tag.

 
 

   Command line was: /usr/lib/jvm/java-8-openjdk-amd64/jre/../bin/javadoc "-Xdoclint:none --allow-script-in-comments" -Xdoclint:none @options @packages @argfile    38444   38445Refer to the generated Javadoc files in '/root/flink/target/site/apidocs' dir.    38446   38447org.apache.maven.reporting.MavenReportException:    38448Exit code: 1 - /root/flink/flink-end-to-end-tests/flink-confluent-schema-registry/target/generated-sources/example/avro/EventType.java:8: error: type GenericEnumSymbol does not take parameters    38449public enum EventType implements org.apache.avro.generic.GenericEnumSymbol<EventType> {        38450 ^    38451/root/flink/flink-annotations/src/main/java/org/apache/flink/annotation/docs/ConfigGroup.java:33: warning - Tag @link: reference not found: ConfigOptionsDocGenerator    38452/root/flink/flink-test-utils-parent/flink-test-utils-junit/src/main/java/org/apache/flink/testutils/junit/extensions/parameterized/Parameter.java:34: warning - Tag @link: reference not found: Parameterized.Parameter    38453/root/flink/flink-test-utils-parent/flink-test-utils-junit/src/main/java/org/apache/flink/core/testutils/CustomExtension.java:46: warning - Missing closing '}' character for inline tag: "{@code    38454 public class Test{    38455 CustomExtension eachCustom = new CustomExtensionImpl1();    38456 CustomExtension allCustom = new CustomExtensionImpl2();"    38457/root/flink/flink-test-utils-parent/flink-test-utils-junit/src/main/java/org/apache/flink/core/testutils/CustomExtension.java:46: warning - @RegisterExtension is an unknown tag.

 

I think the action is failing silently and leading to broken documentation . 
Please validate if my speculation is correct.

reference :

1. https://github.com/apache/flink/actions/runs/9848601763/job/27190828070#step:5:38336 
2. https://github.com/apache/flink/actions/runs/9848601763/job/27190828070#step:5:38559

Thanks a lot for the detailed analysis.

The 1.17 javadocs also look pretty broken: https://nightlies.apache.org/flink/flink-docs-release-1.17/api/java/example/avro/EventType.html

Ideally we integrate the javadocs build into our PR validation to avoid this issue in the future
